p: For the temperature index, ‘a’ represents the lower threshold (18 °C for Pf, and 16 °C for Pv), ‘d’ represents the upper threshold (32 °C for both Pf and Pv), beyond which the membership function is 0 that is ‘least suitable’; whereas, ‘b’ and ‘c’ represent 24 °C and 28 °C, respectively, this range has been identified as the ‘most suitable’ range for malaria transmission [ 48, 55], the membership function is 1. Similarly, for RH scalar parameters a, b, c and d are 40, 55, 80 and 95, respectively, where the membership function for the range 55% and 80% is 1 as ‘most suitable’, and as the value moves away from the range towards 40% or 95%, the membership function decreases to 0, representing ‘least suitable’ ( Table 1).
